com.camerontec.catalys.mis.ler.client

Class LogEventsRepositoryClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.spring.components.base.BaseComponentWithName
      • com.camerontec.util.spring.components.base.BaseComponentWithLogger
        • com.camerontec.util.spring.components.base.BaseComponentWithLifeCycle
          • com.camerontec.util.spring.components.base.BaseComponent
            • com.camerontec.catalys.mis.ler.client.LogEventsRepositoryClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ILogEventsRepositoryReader, com.camerontec.catalys.mis.ler.ILuceneRepositoryAccessParameters, com.camerontec.util.spring.components.IHasLifeCycle, com.camerontec.util.spring.components.IHasName, org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanNameAware

    public class LogEventsRepositoryClient
extends com.camerontec.util.spring.components.base.BaseComponent
implements ILogEventsRepositoryReader, com.camerontec.catalys.mis.ler.ILuceneRepositoryAccessParameters
    This class provides external applications with a client API for accessing the MIS's Log Events Repository.

    Typical usage is as follows: 
         
     // Create a new repository client
     //
     LogEventsRepositoryClient client = new LogEventsRepositoryClient();
     
     // Configure the repository client. 
     // - On-disk storage location
     //
     client.setStorageLocation("/tmp/data/log-events-repository");
     
     // Now initialize the client. This is the point where configuration-related errors will be reported. 
     //
     client.initialize();
       
     // You are ready to use the client to interact with the repository. The code below prints the list of available file loggers to the
     // console
     //
     System.out.printf("Available file loggers:\n");
     for (FileLoggerID fileLogger: client.fileLoggers())
     {
         System.out.printf("\t%s\n", fileLogger);
     }
       
     // Shut down the client when done
     //
     client.shutdown();


    The Log Events Repository client uses log4j for logging. Below are the default logging settings (under the form of a log4j.properties file). You can alter these settings by prepending your own log4j.properties or log4j.xml file to your classpath when using the client. 
     
 log4j.rootLogger = info, stdout
 
 log4j.logger.org = warn
 
 log4j.logger.openjpa = error
 
 log4j.appender.stdout                          = org.apache.log4j.ConsoleAppender
 log4j.appender.stdout.layout                   = org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout
 log4j.appender.stdout.layout.ConversionPattern = %d %p [%c] - %m%n
 log4j.appender.stdout.target                   = System.out
    The Log Events Repository client is thread-safe.

        Reads log events occurring strictly after the given event.

        eventsAfter in interface ILogEventsRepositoryReader
        Parameters:
        from - the ID of the last log event that should not be part of the result. Use a null value to request log events from the start of the repository
        numberOfLogEvents - the maximum number of log events to return
        Returns:
        a List of LogEvent objects ordered by ID
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfLogEvents is not a positive integer

      • search

        @Deprecated
public SearchResults search(Map<com.camerontec.catalys.common.logger.FileLoggerID,Set<String>> categoriesByFileLogger,
                                        Long from,
                                        Long to,
                                        com.camerontec.catalys.mis.ler.DateFilter dateFilter,
                                        EnumSet<Level> levels,
                                        String query,
                                        List<com.camerontec.catalys.mis.common.logs.Tuple<Integer,String>> tagValues,
                                        int offset,
                                        int numberOfResults,
                                        int cachingMemoryLimit)
                                 throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                        LogEventsRepositoryAccessException
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from interface: ILogEventsRepositoryReader
        Performs a search in the log events repository.

        This method is typically called first to return one page of results, and the ISearchContext it returns as part of the resulting SearchResults can be reused to run further searches with the same criteria. The returned ISearchContext may or may not cache the query's entire result set based on the specified caching memory limit. Even if the entire result set does not fit within the given limit, reusing the ISearchContext in further calls is likely to given faster results than calling this method again. Note: field names in Lucene queries are not supported. Using a query that contains field names has undefined results.
        Specified by:
        search in interface ILogEventsRepositoryReader
        Parameters:
        categoriesByFileLogger - identifies the file loggers and categories for which log events should be returned. For a given FileLoggerID, a null or empty set of categories means that all the categories present in the repository for that file logger should be considered. A null map altogether indicates that no filtering based on file loggers and categories should be performed.
        from - the lower time limit of the search; restricts the search to log events with a time stamp greater than or equal to the given value. Note that this does not need to be the exact time stamp of a log event in the repository. A null value means no lower time limit.
        to - the upper time limit of the search; restricts the search to log events with a time stamp less than or equal to the given value. Note that this does not need to be the exact time stamp of a log event in the repository. A null value means no upper time limit.
        dateFilter - a preselected date may be set, e.g. Today or Yesterday etc. This will override the values for from and to. A value of DateFilter.SELECTED_DATES means use the from and to values.
        levels - limits the search to a set of log levels. A null value can be used if no filtering on log levels is needed
        query - a search query expressed in the Lucene query language that defines textual search criteria to be evaluated against the message part of log events. A null value or an empty string can be used if no textual search is needed.
        tagValues - tag values a field value for the specified tag
        offset - the zero-based offset, within the entire set of log events matching the search criteria, of the first log event to be returned
        numberOfResults - the desired number of results
        cachingMemoryLimit - the maximum amount of memory, expressed in Mb, that can be used to cache search results into the returned ISearchContext
        Returns:
        a SearchResults object containing:
        • the total number of results
        • the offset of the first result
        • one page of actual results of type HighlightedLogEvent
        • a SearchContext instance which can then be reused to speed-up further searches using the same criteria.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either of the following occurs:
        • categoriesByFileLogger is empty
        • to is less than from
        • either from or to is negative
        • offset is not a positive integer
        • numberOfResults is not a strictly positive integer
        • cachingMemoryLimit is not a strictly positive integer
        • query cannot be parsed
        • a tag is provided without a value being specified (or conversely)
        LogEventsRepositoryAccessException - if an error occurs while attempting to read from the repository

        Description copied from interface: ILogEventsRepositoryReader
        Performs a search in the log events repository.

        This method is typically called first to return one page of results, and the ISearchContext it returns as part of the resulting SearchResults can be reused to run further searches with the same criteria. The returned ISearchContext may or may not cache the query's entire result set based on the specified caching memory limit. Even if the entire result set does not fit within the given limit, reusing the ISearchContext in further calls is likely to given faster results than calling this method again. Note: field names in Lucene queries are not supported. Using a query that contains field names has undefined results.
        Specified by:
        search in interface ILogEventsRepositoryReader
        Parameters:
        categoriesByFileLogger - identifies the file loggers and categories for which log events should be returned. For a given FileLoggerID, a null or empty set of categories means that all the categories present in the repository for that file logger should be considered. A null map altogether indicates that no filtering based on file loggers and categories should be performed.
        from - the lower time limit of the search; restricts the search to log events with a time stamp greater than or equal to the given value. Note that this does not need to be the exact time stamp of a log event in the repository. A null value means no lower time limit.
        to - the upper time limit of the search; restricts the search to log events with a time stamp less than or equal to the given value. Note that this does not need to be the exact time stamp of a log event in the repository. A null value means no upper time limit.
        dateFilter - a preselected date may be set, e.g. Today or Yesterday etc. This will override the values for from and to. A value of DateFilter.SELECTED_DATES means use the from and to values.
        levels - limits the search to a set of log levels. A null value can be used if no filtering on log levels is needed
        query - a search query expressed in the Lucene query language that defines textual search criteria to be evaluated against the message part of log events. A null value or an empty string can be used if no textual search is needed.
        tagValues - tag values a field value for the specified tag
        offset - the zero-based offset, within the entire set of log events matching the search criteria, of the first log event to be returned
        numberOfResults - the desired number of results
        Returns:
        a SearchResults object containing:
        • the total number of results
        • the offset of the first result
        • one page of actual results of type HighlightedLogEvent
        • a SearchContext instance which can then be reused to speed-up further searches using the same criteria.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either of the following occurs:
        • categoriesByFileLogger is empty
        • to is less than from
        • either from or to is negative
        • offset is not a positive integer
        • numberOfResults is not a strictly positive integer
        • cachingMemoryLimit is not a strictly positive integer
        • query cannot be parsed
        • a tag is provided without a value being specified (or conversely)
        LogEventsRepositoryAccessException - if an error occurs while attempting to read from the repository

      • search

        public SearchResults search(ISearchContext searchContext,
                            int offset,
                            int numberOfResults)
                     throws IllegalArgumentException,
                            LogEventsRepositoryAccessException
        Description copied from interface: ILogEventsRepositoryReader
        Re-runs a search in the log events repository.

        This method takes as parameter an ISearchContext instance which has been returned by a previous call to ILogEventsRepositoryReader.search(Map, Long, Long, DateFilter, EnumSet, String, List, int, int, int) and wraps search criteria and potentially contains cached search results.
        Specified by:
        search in interface ILogEventsRepositoryReader
        Parameters:
        searchContext - wraps the search criteria to re-use and potentially also contains cached search results the zero-based offset, within the entire set of log events matching the search criteria, of the first log event to be returned
        offset - the zero-based offset, within the entire set of log events matching the search criteria, of the first log event to be returned
        numberOfResults - the desired number of results
        Returns:
        a SearchResults object containing:
        • the total number of results
        • the offset of the first result
        • one page of actual results of type HighlightedLogEvent
        • a SearchContext instance which can then be reused to speed-up further searches using the same criteria.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either of the following occurs:
        • offset is not a positive integer
        • offset is greater than the total size of the result set
        • numberOfResults is not a strictly positive integer
        LogEventsRepositoryAccessException - if an error occurs while attempting to read from the repository

      • tail

        public TailResults tail(Map<com.camerontec.catalys.common.logger.FileLoggerID,Set<String>> categoriesByFileLogger,
                        Long from,
                        Long to,
                        com.camerontec.catalys.mis.ler.DateFilter dateFilter,
                        EnumSet<Level> levels,
                        String query,
                        List<com.camerontec.catalys.mis.common.logs.Tuple<Integer,String>> tagValues,
                        int numberOfResults)
                 throws IllegalArgumentException,
                        LogEventsRepositoryAccessException
        Description copied from interface: ILogEventsRepositoryReader
        Performs a search in the log events repository and returns the last page of results without any paging information.

        Note: field names in Lucene queries are not supported. Using a query that contains field names has undefined results.
        Specified by:
        tail in interface ILogEventsRepositoryReader
        Parameters:
        categoriesByFileLogger - identifies the file loggers and categories for which log events should be returned. For a given FileLoggerID, a null or empty set of categories means that all the categories present in the repository for that file logger should be considered.
        from - the lower time limit of the search; restricts the search to log events with a time stamp greater than or equal to the given value. Note that this does not need to be the exact time stamp of a log event in the repository. A null value means no lower time limit.
        to - the upper time limit of the search; restricts the search to log events with a time stamp less than or equal to the given value. Note that this does not need to be the exact time stamp of a log event in the repository. A null value means no upper time limit.
        dateFilter - a preselected date may be set, e.g. Today or Yesterday etc. This will override the values for from and to. A value of DateFilter.SELECTED_DATES means use the from and to values.
        levels - limits the search to a set of log levels. A null value can be used if no filtering on log levels is needed
        query - a search query expressed in the Lucene query language that defines textual search criteria to be evaluated against the message part of log events. A null value or an empty string can be used if no textual search is needed.
        tagValues - tag values a field value for the specified tag
        numberOfResults - the desired number of results
        Returns:
        a TailResults object containing:
        • the total number of results
        • one page of actual results of type LogEvent
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either of the following occurs:
        • categoriesByFileLoggerID is empty
        • numberOfResults is not a strictly positive integer
        • query cannot be parsed
        • a tag is provided without a value being specified (or conversely)
        LogEventsRepositoryAccessException - if an error occurs while attempting to read from the repository

      • find

        public List<HighlightedLogEvent> find(ISearchContext searchContext,
                                      String findText,
                                      com.camerontec.util.logger.FindDirection direction,
                                      long idAtOffset,
                                      int offset,
                                      boolean startAtOffset,
                                      int numberOfResultsInEachDirection)
        Description copied from interface: ILogEventsRepositoryReader
        Searches for text from the current location. The search is performed forwards and backwards from the current location for a specified number of results. The current search is represented by a search context.
        Specified by:
        find in interface ILogEventsRepositoryReader
        Parameters:
        searchContext - Represents the current result set we are searching over.
        findText - The text being searched for.
        direction - The direction of the find.
        idAtOffset - The logger id at our current position.
        offset - The numeric position with the result set of our current position (0 based).
        startAtOffset - Specifies whether or not offset is included in find. If True it is.
        numberOfResultsInEachDirection - The number of matches to return in each direction, or the number of matches found if less.
        Returns:
        A list of log events, where each log event is a matching line.

        public List<com.camerontec.catalys.mis.ler.LogEventWithID> events(Long... ids)
